snippet: For Lt. Col. Richard Brunk, a former Army chaplain, two instances of traumatic brain injury from blasts in Iraq have tugged away at a mask of good cheer.
abstract: Lt Col Richard Brunk, former Army chaplain who was left with traumatic brain injury by two explosions in Iraq, still suffers from symptoms seven years later; he is one of over 260,000 people in the US military diagnosed with TBI, and is facing, at age 62, a much steeper path to recovery than a younger person would (Series: The Hard Road Back).
lead_paragraph: For Lt. Col. Richard Brunk, a former Army chaplain, two instances of traumatic brain injury from blasts in Iraq have tugged away at a mask of good cheer.

headline.print_headline: Used to Helping, A Chaplain Finds The Tables Turned
headline.seo: Chaplain with Traumatic Brain Injuries, Finds Tables Turned
headline.main: Used to Helping, a Chaplain Finds the Tables Turned
